intro: Justicia allocota, commonly known as the Mexican flame flower, is a tropical shrub native to Central America and the Caribbean. It is characterized by its vibrant red, tubular flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees. The plant has lance-shaped, dark green leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Justicia allocota is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in warm, humid climates.
